titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Inclusive Economies, Office Files of Laine Romero-Alston
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Inclusive Economies, Office Files of Laine Romero-Alston FA1376

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-11-01 04:28:06 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Inclusive Economies, Office Files of Laine Romero-Alston

physdesc.extent: 7 document boxes: 6 letter size boxes and 1 legal size box

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at the RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files, and officers' papers were transferred to and accessioned by the RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.
This material was transferred to the RAC in two accessions in 2021 and was ingested by the RAC as Accessions 2021:025 and 2021:083.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains the office files Laine Romero-Alston created when she worked as a Program Officer in the Ford Foundation's inclusive economic development programs. Files document the progression of Romero-Alston's work at the Foundation from managing Next Generation Workforce Strategies grants in the Quality Employment unit of the Economic Opportunity and Assets Program (EOA) to managing Quality Work and Economic Security (QWRS) grants in Inclusive Economies (IE). Romero-Alston also worked on the Foundation's Future of Work (FOW) initiative.
The collection consists of two series. Notebooks Romero-Alston created through her activities are contained in the first series. Romero-Alston's subject files are contained in the second series.

Files in the collection document Romero-Alston's leadership of the Ford Foundation's programming for supporting sustainable and inclusive workforce development. Grants and initiatives focused on global workers, immigrant and migrant workers, informal workers, service workers in various industries, low-wage workers, worker centers, labor unions, job quality, workers' rights, human rights, global labor, and global supply chains. There is a lot of focus on strategy and capacity building and the increasing global perspective of the Foundation's workforce development and job quality programming through the emergence of QWES in IE.
Common material formats found throughout the collection include correspondence, memos, notes, proposals, reports, meeting materials, drafts, budget spreadsheets, articles, and publications.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is comprised of two series.
Original order was maintained as much as possible.
The collection arrangement is as follows:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains notebooks Laine Romero-Alston created when she worked as a Program Officer in the Ford Foundation's programming for inclusive economic development. The notebooks span across Romero-Alson's positions in Quality Employment in the Economic Opportunity and Assets Program (EOA) and then Quality Work and Economic Security (QWES) in Inclusive Economies (IE). Not all the notebooks in the series were clearly dated, so inferences were made from content in the notebooks when it was available. Efforts were not made to organize these notebooks chronologically because of their uncertain dates.
Romero-Alston used the notebooks for meetings and trips, "to do" lists, job quality and workforce development program interests, and internal Ford Foundation activities.
A few other items were inserted into the notebooks which document Romero-Alston's participation in different meetings and trips including agendas, itineraries, business cards, and correspondence.

did.unittitle: EDGE (Engaged Donors for Global Equity) Funders Alliance Conference April 2018, New Orleans, Louisiana notebook

physdesc.extent: 5.5 document boxes: 4.5 letter size boxes and 1 legal size box

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the subject files Laine Romero-Alston created when she worked as a Program Officer in the Ford Foundation's programs for inclusive economic development. The subject files span across Romero-Alston's positions in Quality Employment in the Economic Opportunity and Assets Program (EOA) and then Quality Work and Economic Security (QWES) in Inclusive Economies (IE). The subject files in the series are organized by different themes including grantees, BUILD grantees, strategy and Theory of Change (TOC), global, budget, funders groups, Ford Foundation working groups, and Future of Work (FOW).
Materials in the series document Romero-Alston's management of a grant portfolio regarding sustainable inclusive economic development and support of Ford Foundation program strategy development.
Files in the series contain correspondence, notes, reports, proposals, meeting materials, drafts, articles, budget spreadsheets, and publications.
